column4: Now after the death of Y’hoshua [Yehovah is Salvation] it came to pass, that the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] asked the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) , saying, Who shall go up for us against the Kena’ani [Merchant] first, to fight against them?
And the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) said, Y’hudah [Let Him (God) Be Praised] shall go up: behold, I have delivered the land into his hand.

And Y’hudah [Let Him (God) Be Praised] said unto Shim’on [he who hears] his brother, Come up with me into my lot, that we may fight against the Kena’ani [Merchant] ; and I likewise will go with you i into you i lot. So Shim’on [he who hears] went with him.

And Y’hudah [Let Him (God) Be Praised] went up; and the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) delivered the Kena’ani [Merchant] and the P’rizi [Dwellers in Unwalled Towns] into their hand: and they killed of them in Bezek [Lightning] ten thousand men.
And they found Adonis--Bezek [My Lord is Lightning] in Bezek [Lightning] : and they fought against him, and they killed the Kena’ani [Merchant] and the P’rizi [Dwellers in Unwalled Towns].
But Adonis--Bezek [My Lord is Lightning] fled; and they pursued after him, and caught him, and cut off his thumbs and his great toes.

And Adonis--Bezek [My Lord is Lightning] said, Threescore and ten kings, having their thumbs and their great toes cut off, gathered [their meat] under my table: as I have done, so God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] has requited me. And they brought him to Yerushalayim [Foundation of Peace] , and there he died.
Now the children of Y’hudah [Let Him (God) Be Praised] had fought against Yerushalayim [Foundation of Peace] , and had taken it, and smitten it with the edge of the sword, and set the city on fire.
And afterward the children of Y’hudah [Let Him (God) Be Praised] went down to fight against the Kena’ani [Merchant] , that dwelt in the mountain, and in the south, and in the valley.

And Y’hudah [Let Him (God) Be Praised] went against the Kena’ani [Merchant] that dwelt in Hevron [Seat of Association] : (now the name of Hevron [Seat of Association] before [was] Kiryat-Arba [City of Arba (four)] :) and they killed Sheshai [Noble] , and Achiman [My Brother is a Gift] , and Talmai [Plowman].
And from there he went against the inhabitants of D’vir [Sanctuary] : and the name of D’vir [Sanctuary] before [was] Kiryat-Sepher [City of the Book]:
And Kalev [Dog] said, He that smites Kiryat-Sepher [City of the Book] , and takes it, to him will I give ‘Akhsah [Anklet] my daughter to wife.
And ‘Otni’el [Lion of God] the son of K’naz [Hunter] , Kalev [Dog] ’s younger brother, took it: and he gave him ‘Akhsah [Anklet] his daughter to wife.
And it came to pass, when she came [to him] , that she moved him to ask of her father a field: and she lighted from off [her] ass; and Kalev [Dog] said unto her, What will you i?
And she said unto him, Give me a blessing: for you i have given me a south land; give me also springs of water. And Kalev [Dog] gave her the upper springs and the lower springs.

And the children of the Kayin [Possession] , Moshe [He Who Draws Out Of The Waters] ’ father in law, went up out of the city of palm trees with the children of Y’hudah [Let Him (God) Be Praised] into the wilderness of Y’hudah [Let Him (God) Be Praised] , which [lies] in the south of ‘Arad [A Wild Ass] ; and they went and dwelt among the people.

And Y’hudah [Let Him (God) Be Praised] went with Shim’on [he who hears] his brother, and they killed the Kena’ani [Merchant] that inhabited Zephath, and utterly destroyed it. And the name of the city was called Hormah [Asylum].

Also Y’hudah [Let Him (God) Be Praised] took ‘Azah [The Strong] with the coast thereof, and Askelon [The Fire of Infamy: I shall be Weighed] with the coast thereof, and ‘Ekron [Torn Up by the Roots] with the coast thereof.

And the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) was with Y’hudah [Let Him (God) Be Praised] ; and he drove out [the inhabitants of] the mountain; but could not drive out the inhabitants of the valley, because they had chariots of iron.
And they gave Hevron [Seat of Association] unto Kalev [Dog] , as Moshe [He Who Draws Out Of The Waters] said: and he expelled there the three sons of Anak [Neck].

And the children of Binyamin [Son of the Right Hand/Strength] did not drive out the Y’vusi [Threshers, Trampled Under Foot] that inhabited Yerushalayim [Foundation of Peace] ; but the Y’vusi [Threshers, Trampled Under Foot] dwell with the children of Binyamin [Son of the Right Hand/Strength] in Yerushalayim [Foundation of Peace] unto this day.
And the house of Yosef [(God) He Shall Add] , they also went up against Beit-El [House of God] : and the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) [was] with them.
And the house of Yosef [ (God) He Shall Add] sent to descry (search out; map out; to describe) Beit-El [House of God] . (Now the name of the city before [was] Luz [Almond Tree] .)
And the spies saw a man come forth out of the city, and they said unto him, Show us, we pray you i , the entrance into the city, and we will show you i mercy.
And when he showed them the entrance into the city, they struck the city with the edge of the sword; but they let go the man and all his family.
And the man went into the land of the Hitti [Terrorists] , and built a city, and called the name thereof Luz [Almond Tree] : which [is] the name thereof unto this day.

Neither did M’nasheh [Causing to Forget] drive out [the inhabitants of] Beit-Sh’an [House of Ease] and her towns, nor Ta’anakh [Sandy] and her towns, nor the inhabitants of Dor [Generation] and her towns, nor the inhabitants of Yivle’am [Devouring the People] and her towns, nor the inhabitants of Megiddo [Place of Crowds] and her towns: but the Kena’ani [Merchant] would dwell in that land.
And it came to pass, when Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] was strong, that they put the Kena’ani [Merchant] to tribute, and did not utterly drive them out.
Neither did Efrayim [Doubly Fruitful] drive out the Kena’ani [Merchant] that dwelt in Gezer [Portion] ; but the Kena’ani [Merchant] dwelt in Gezer [Portion] among them.

Neither did Z’vulun [Glorious Dwelling Place] drive out the inhabitants of Kitron [Incense] , nor the inhabitants of Nahalol [Pasture] ; but the Kena’ani [Merchant] dwelt among them, and became tributaries.

Neither did Asher [Happy] drive out the inhabitants of ‘Akko [His Straitness] , nor the inhabitants of Tzidon [Hunting] , nor of Ahlav [Fertile Place] , nor of Achziv [Deceit] , nor of Helbah [Fertile] , nor of Afik [Enclosure] , nor of Rechov [Broad Place]:
But the Asheri [Happy] dwelt among the Kena’ani [Merchant] , the inhabitants of the land: for they did not drive them out.

Neither did Naftali [My Wrestling] drive out the inhabitants of Beit-Shemesh [House of the Sun] , nor the inhabitants of Beit-’Anat [House of Response (or Affliction)] ; but he dwelt among the Kena’ani [Merchant] , the inhabitants of the land: nevertheless the inhabitants of Beit-Shemesh [House of the Sun] and of Beit-’Anat [House of Response (or Affliction)] became tributaries unto them.
And the Emori [Highlanders] forced the children of Dan [Judge] into the mountain: for they would not suffer them to come down to the valley:

But the Emori [Highlanders] would dwell in mount Heres [The Sun] in Ayalon [Field of Deer] , and in Sha’alvim [Place of Foxes] : yet the hand of the house of Yosef [ (God) He Shall Add] prevailed, so that they became tributaries.
And the coast of the Emori [Highlanders] [was] from the going up to ‘Akrabbim [Ascent of Scorpions] , from the rock, and upward.

And an angel of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) came up from Gilgal [A Wheel, Rolling] to Bokhim [Weeping] , and said, I made you to go up out of Mitzrayim [Egypt - The Narrow Place] , and have brought you unto the land which I swore unto your fathers; and I said, I will never break my covenant with you.
And you 2f shall make no league with the inhabitants of this land; you 2f shall throw down their altars: but you 2f have not obeyed my voice: why have you 2f done this?
For what reason I also said, I will not drive them out from before you; but they shall be [as thorns] in your sides, and their gods shall be a snare unto you.

And it came to pass, when the angel of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) spoke these words unto all the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] , that the people lifted up their voice, and wept.
And they called the name of that place Bokhim [Weeping] : and they sacrificed there unto the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate).
And when Y’hoshua [Yehovah is Salvation] had let the people go, the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] went every man unto his inheritance to possess the land.

And the people served the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) all the days of Y’hoshua [Yehovah is Salvation] , and all the days of the elders that outlived Y’hoshua [Yehovah is Salvation] , who had seen all the great works of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) , that he did for Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God].
And Y’hoshua [Yehovah is Salvation] the son of Nun [Posterity] , the servant of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) , died, [being] an hundred and ten years old.
And they buried him in the border of his inheritance in Timnat-Heres [Portion of the Sun] , in the mount of Efrayim [Doubly Fruitful] , on the north side of the hill Ga’ash [Quaking].

And also all that generation were gathered unto their fathers: and there arose another generation after them, which knew not the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) , nor yet the works which he had done for Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God].
And the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] did evil in the sight of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) , and served Ba’alim [lords (false gods)]:

And they forsook the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] of their fathers, which brought them out of the land of Mitzrayim [Egypt - The Narrow Place] , and followed other gods, of the gods of the people that [were] round about them, and bowed themselves unto them, and provoked the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) to anger.
And they forsook the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) , and served Ba’al [lord (a false god)] and ‘Ashtarot [Star (female deity)].

And the anger of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) was hot against Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] , and he delivered them into the hands of spoilers that spoiled them, and he sold them into the hands of their enemies round about, so that they could not any longer stand before their enemies.

Whithersoever they went out, the hand of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) was against them for evil, as the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) had said, and as the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) had sworn unto them: and they were greatly distressed.
Nevertheless the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) raised up judges, which delivered them out of the hand of those that spoiled them.

And yet they would not hearken unto their judges, but they went a whoring after other gods, and bowed themselves unto them: they turned quickly out of the way which their fathers walked in, obeying the commandments of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate); [but] they did not so.

And when the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) raised them up judges, then the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) was with the judge, and delivered them out of the hand of their enemies all the days of the judge: for it repented the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) because of their groanings by reason of them that oppressed them and vexed them.

And it came to pass, when the judge was dead, [that] they returned, and corrupted [themselves] more than their fathers, in following other gods to serve them, and to bow down unto them; they ceased not from their own doings, nor from their stubborn way.

And the anger of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) was hot against Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] ; and he said, Because that this people has transgressed my covenant which I commanded their fathers, and have not listened unto my voice;
I also will not from this time forth (from now on) drive out any from before them of the nations which Y’hoshua [Yehovah is Salvation] left when he died:

That through them I may prove Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] , whether they will keep the way of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) to walk in it, as their fathers did keep [it] , or not.
Therefore the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) left those nations, without driving them out hastily; neither delivered he them into the hand of Y’hoshua [Yehovah is Salvation].

Now these [are] the nations which the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) left, to prove Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] by them, [even] as many [of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God]] as had not known all the wars of Kena’an [Merchant];
Only that the generations of the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] might know, to teach them war, at the least such as before knew nothing thereof;

[Namely] , five lords of the P’lishtim [Immigrants] , and all the Kena’ani [Merchant] , and the Tzidonim [Hunting] , and the Hivi [Villagers] that dwelt in mount L’vanon [Whiteness] , from mount Ba’al [lord (a false god)] between Mount Ba’al-Hermon [Lord of Destruction] unto the entering in of Hamat [Fortress].

And they were to prove Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] by them, to know whether they would hearken unto the commandments of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) , which he commanded their fathers by the hand of Moshe [He Who Draws Out Of The Waters].

And the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] dwelt among the Kena’ani [Merchant] , Hitti [Terrorists] , and Emori [Highlanders] , and P’rizi [Dwellers in Unwalled Towns] , and Hivi [Villagers] , and Y’vusi [Threshers, Trampled Under Foot]:
And they took their daughters to be their wives, and gave their daughters to their sons, and served their gods.

And the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] did evil in the sight of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) , and forgot the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) their God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] , and served Ba’alim [lords (false gods)] and the groves.

Therefore the anger of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) was hot against Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] , and he sold them into the hand of Kushan-Rish’atayim [Twice-Wicked Full of Darkness (A Reference to Ethiopia)] king of Aram (Mesopotamia/Aram (Syria) [exalted]) [Elevated Between the Two Rivers] : and the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] served Kushan-Rish’atayim [Twice-Wicked Full of Darkness (A Reference to Ethiopia)] eight years.

And when the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] cried unto the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) , the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) raised up a deliverer to the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] , who delivered them, [even] ‘Otni’el [Lion of God] the son of K’naz [Hunter] , Kalev [Dog] ’s younger brother.

And the Spirit of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) came upon him, and he judged Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] , and went out to war: and the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) delivered Kushan-Rish’atayim [Twice-Wicked Full of Darkness (A Reference to Ethiopia)] king of Aram (Mesopotamia/Aram (Syria) [exalted]) [Elevated Between the Two Rivers] into his hand; and his hand prevailed against Kushan-Rish’atayim [Twice-Wicked Full of Darkness (A Reference to Ethiopia)].
And the land had rest forty years. And ‘Otni’el [Lion of God] the son of K’naz [Hunter] died.

And the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] did evil again in the sight of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) : and the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) strengthened ‘Eglon [Calf-like] the king of Mo’av [Seed of my Father] against Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] , because they had done evil in the sight of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate).
And he gathered unto him the children of ‘Amon [Inbred] and ‘Amalek [Dweller in a Valley] , and went and struck Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] , and possessed the city of palm trees.
So the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] served ‘Eglon [Calf-like] the king of Mo’av [Seed of my Father] eighteen years.

But when the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] cried unto the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) , the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) raised them up a deliverer, Ehud [I will Give Thanks: I will be Praised] the son of Gera [A Grain] , from the tribe of Binyamin [A Son of the Right Hand] , a man left-handed: and by him the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] sent a present unto ‘Eglon [Calf-like] the king of Mo’av [Seed of my Father].
But Ehud [I will Give Thanks: I will be Praised] made him a dagger which had two edges, of a cubit length; and he did gird it under his clothing upon his right thigh.
And he brought the present unto ‘Eglon [Calf-like] king of Mo’av [Seed of my Father] : and ‘Eglon [Calf-like] [was] a very fat man.
And when he had made an end to offer the present, he sent away the people that bore the present.

But he himself turned again from the quarries that [were] by Gilgal [A Wheel, Rolling] , and said, I have a secret errand unto you i , O king: who said, Keep silence. And all that stood by him went out from him.

And Ehud [I will Give Thanks: I will be Praised] came unto him; and he was sitting in a summer parlour, which he had for himself alone. And Ehud [I will Give Thanks: I will be Praised] said, I have a message from God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] unto you i . And he arose out of [his] seat.
And Ehud [I will Give Thanks: I will be Praised] put forth his left hand, and took the dagger from his right thigh, and thrust it into his belly:
And the handle also went in after the blade; and the fat closed upon the blade, so that he could not draw the dagger out of his belly; and the dirt came out.
Then Ehud [I will Give Thanks: I will be Praised] went forth through the porch, and shut the doors of the parlour upon him, and locked them.
When he was gone out, his servants came; and when they saw that, behold, the doors of the parlour [were] locked, they said, Surely he covers his feet in his summer chamber.

And they tarried till they were ashamed: and, behold, he opened not the doors of the parlour; therefore they took a key, and opened [them] : and, behold, their lord [was] fallen down dead on the earth.
And Ehud [I will Give Thanks: I will be Praised] escaped while they tarried, and passed beyond the quarries, and escaped unto Se’irah [The Shaggy].

And it came to pass, when he was come, that he blew a trumpet in the mountain of Efrayim [Doubly Fruitful] , and the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] went down with him from the mount, and he before them.

And he said unto them, Follow after me: for the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) has delivered your enemies the Mo’avi [of his father] into your hand. And they went down after him, and took the fords of Yarden [Descender] toward Mo’av [Seed of my Father] , and did not allow a man to pass over.
And they killed of Mo’av [Seed of my Father] at that time about ten thousand men, all lusty, and all men of valour; and there escaped not a man.
So Mo’av [Seed of my Father] was subdued that day under the hand of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] . And the land had rest eighty years.

And after him was Shamgar [Sword] the son of ‘Anat [Answer] , which killed of the P’lishtim [Immigrants] six hundred men with an ox goad (a pointed stick to get animals moving) : and he also delivered Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God].
And the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] again did evil in the sight of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) , when Ehud [I will Give Thanks: I will be Praised] was dead.

And the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) sold them into the hand of Yavin [Whom God Observes] king of Kena’an [Merchant] , that reigned in Hatzor [Castle] ; the captain of whose host [was] Sisra [Battle Array (to put on; to clothe)], which dwelt in Haroshet-HaGoyim [Woodland of the Gentiles] of the Gentiles.

And the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] cried unto the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) : for he had nine hundred chariots of iron; and twenty years he mightily oppressed the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God].
And D’vorah [Bee] , a prophetess, the wife of Lapidot [Torches] , she judged Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] at that time.

And she dwelt under the palm tree of D’vorah [Bee] between Ramah [Hill] and Beit-El [House of God] in mount Efrayim [Doubly Fruitful] : and the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] came up to her for judgment.

And she sent and called Barak [Lightning] the son of Avino’am [My Father is Delight] out of Kedesh [Holy Place] [Holy Place] in Naftali [My Wrestling] , and said unto him, Has not the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] commanded, [saying] , Go and draw toward mount Tavor [Mound] , and take with you i ten thousand men of the children of Naftali [My Wrestling] and of the children of Z’vulun [Glorious Dwelling Place]?

And I will draw unto you i to the river Kishon [Winding] Sisra [Battle Array (to put on; to clothe)], the captain of Yavin [Whom God Observes] ’s army, with his chariots and his multitude; and I will deliver him into you i hand.
And Barak [Lightning] said unto her, If you i will go with me, then I will go: but if you i will not go with me, [then] I will not go.

And she said, I will surely go with you i : notwithstanding the journey that you i take shall not be for your i honour; for the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) shall sell Sisra [Battle Array (to put on; to clothe)] into the hand of a woman. And D’vorah [Bee] arose, and went with Barak [Lightning] to Kedesh [Holy Place] [Holy Place].

And Barak [Lightning] called Z’vulun [Glorious Dwelling Place] and Naftali [My Wrestling] to Kedesh [Holy Place] ; and he went up with ten thousand men at his feet: and D’vorah [Bee] went up with him.

Now Hever [Comrade] the Kayin [Possession], [which was] of the children of Hovav [Cherished] the father in law of Moshe [He Who Draws Out Of The Waters] , had severed himself from the Keini [traveling tinkers or blacksmiths] , and pitched his tent unto the plain of Tza’ananim [Removings] , which [is] by Kedesh [Holy Place] [Holy Place] ..
And they showed Sisra [Battle Array (to put on; to clothe)] that Barak [Lightning] the son of Avino’am [My Father is Delight] was gone up to mount Tavor [Mound].

And Sisra [Battle Array (to put on; to clothe)] gathered together all his chariots, [even] nine hundred chariots of iron, and all the people that [were] with him, from Haroshet-HaGoyim [Woodland of the Gentiles] unto the river of Kishon [Winding].

And D’vorah [Bee] said unto Barak [Lightning] , Up; for this [is] the day in which the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) has delivered Sisra [Battle Array (to put on; to clothe)] into you i hand: is not the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) gone out before you i ? So Barak [Lightning] went down from mount Tavor [Mound] , and ten thousand men after him.

And the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) scattered (defeated in battle) Sisra [Battle Array (to put on; to clothe)] , and all [his] chariots, and all [his] host, with the edge of the sword before Barak [Lightning] ; so that Sisra [Battle Array (to put on; to clothe)] lighted down off [his] chariot, and fled away on his feet.

But Barak [Lightning] pursued after the chariots, and after the host, unto Haroshet-HaGoyim [Woodland of the Gentiles] of the Gentiles: and all the host of Sisra [Battle Array (to put on; to clothe)] fell upon the edge of the sword; [and] there was not a man left.

However Sisra [Battle Array (to put on; to clothe)] fled away on his feet to the tent of Ya’el [Mountain Goat] the wife of Hever [Comrade] the Kayin [Possession] : for [there was] peace between Yavin [Whom God Observes] the king of Hatzor [Castle] and the house of Hever [Comrade] the Keini [Possession].

And Ya’el [Mountain Goat] went out to meet Sisra [Battle Array (to put on; to clothe)] , and said unto him, Turn in, my lord, turn in to me; fear not. And when he had turned in unto her into the tent, she covered him with a Mantle (cloak; covering garment) (cloak).
And he said unto her, Give me, I pray you i , a little water to drink; for I am thirsty. And she opened a bottle of milk, and gave him drink, and covered him.
Again he said unto her, Stand in the door of the tent, and it shall be, when any man does come and enquire of you i , and say, Is there any man here? that you i shall say, No.

Then Ya’el [Mountain Goat] , Hever’s [Comrade] ’s wife took a nail of the tent, and took an hammer in her hand, and went softly unto him, and struck the nail into his temples, and fastened it into the ground: for he was fast asleep and weary. So he died.

And, behold, as Barak [Lightning] pursued Sisra [Battle Array (to put on; to clothe)] , Ya’el [Mountain Goat] came out to meet him, and said unto him, Come, and I will show you i the man whom you i seek. And when he came into her [tent] , behold, Sisra [Battle Array (to put on; to clothe)] lay dead, and the nail [was] in his temples.
So God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] subdued on that day Yavin [Whom God Observes] the king of Kena’an [Merchant] before the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God].

And Mikhay’hu [Who is Like God?] said unto him, Dwell with me, and be unto me a father and a priest, and I will give you i ten [shekels] of silver by the year, and a suit of apparel, and you i victuals (food for humans) . So the Levi (Levite) [Joined to] (Levite) went in.
And the Levi (Levite) [Joined to] was content to dwell with the man; and the young man was unto him as one of his sons.
And Mikhay’hu [Who is Like God?] consecrated the Levi (Levite) [Joined to] ; and the young man became his priest, and was in the house of Mikhay’hu [Who is Like God?].
Then said Mikhay’hu [Who is Like God?] , Now know I that the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) will do me good, seeing I have a Levi (Levite) [Joined to] to [my] priest.

In those days [there was] no king in Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] : and in those days the tribe of the Dani (Dan) [Judge] sought them an inheritance to dwell in; for unto that day [all their] inheritance had not fallen unto them among the tribes of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God].

And the children of Dan [Judge] sent of their family five men from their coasts, men of valour, from Tzor’ah [Hornet] , and from Eshta’ol [Entreaty] , to spy out the land, and to search it; and they said unto them, Go, search the land: who when they came to mount Efrayim [Doubly Fruitful] , to the house of Mikhay’hu [Who is Like God?] , they lodged there.

When they [were] by the house of Mikhay’hu [Who is Like God?] , they knew the voice of the young man the Levi (Levite) [Joined to] : and they turned in there, and said unto him, Who brought you i here? and what do you make in this [place] ? and what have you i here?
And he said unto them, Thus and thus deals Mikhay’hu [Who is Like God?] with me, and has hired me, and I am his priest.
And they said unto him, Ask counsel, we pray you i , of God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] , that we may know whether our way which we go shall be prosperous.
And the priest said unto them, Go in peace: before the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) [is] your way wherein you 2f go.

Then the five men departed, and came to Layish [Lion] , and saw the people that [were] in it, how they dwelt careless, after the manner of the people of Tzidon [Hunting] , quiet and secure; and [there was] no magistrate in the land, that might put [them] to shame in [any] thing; and they [were] far from the people of Tzidon [Hunting] , and had no business with [any] man.
And they came unto their brethren to Tzor’ah [Hornet] and Eshta’ol [Entreaty] : and their brethren said unto them, What [say] you 2f?
And they said, Arise, that we may go up against them: for we have seen the land, and, behold, it [is] very good: and [are] you 2f still? be not slothful to go, [and] to enter to possess the land.

When you 2f go, you 2f shall come unto a people secure, and to a large land: for God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] has given it into your hands; a place where [there is] no lack of anything that [is] in the earth.
And there went from there of the family of the Dani (Dan) [Judge] , out of Tzor’ah [Hornet] and out of Eshta’ol [Entreaty] , six hundred men appointed with weapons of war.

And they went up, and pitched in Kiryat-Ye’arim [City of Forests] , in Y’hudah [Let Him (God) Be Praised] : wherefore they called that place Machaneh-Dan [Camp of (the) Judge] unto this day: behold, [it is] behind Kiryat-Ye’arim [City of Forests].
And they passed there unto mount Efrayim [Doubly Fruitful] , and came unto the house of Mikhay’hu [Who is Like God?].

Then answered the five men that went to spy out the country of Layish [Lion] , and said unto their brethren, Do you 2f know that there is in these houses an ephod (vest) , and teraphim (household gods) , and a graven image, and a molten image? now therefore consider what you 2f have to do.
And they turned toward it, and came to the house of the young man the Levi (Levite) [Joined to], [even] unto the house of Mikhay’hu [Who is Like God?] , and saluted him.
And the six hundred men appointed with their weapons of war, which [were] of the children of Dan [Judge] , stood by the entering of the gate.

And the five men that went to spy out the land went up, [and] came in there, [and] took the graven image, and the ephod (vest) , and the teraphim (household gods) , and the molten image: and the priest stood in the entering of the gate with the six hundred men [that were] appointed with weapons of war.

And these went into Mikhay’hu [Who is Like God?] ’s house, and fetched the carved image, the ephod (vest) , and the teraphim (household gods) , and the molten image. Then said the priest unto them, What do you 2f?

And they said unto him, Hold your i peace, lay your i hand upon you i mouth, and go with us, and be to us a father and a priest: [is it] better for you i to be a priest unto the house of one man, or that you i be a priest unto a tribe and a family in Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God]?
And the priest’s heart was glad, and he took the ephod (vest) , and the teraphim (household gods) , and the graven image, and went in the midst of the people.
So they turned and departed, and put the little ones and the cattle and the carriage (baggage) before them.

[And] when they were a good way from the house of Mikhay’hu [Who is Like God?] , the men that [were] in the houses near to Mikhay’hu [Who is Like God?] ’s house were gathered together, and overtook the children of Dan [Judge].
And they cried unto the children of Dan [Judge] . And they turned their faces, and said unto Mikhay’hu [Who is Like God?] , What ails you i , that you i come with such a company?
And he said, You 2f have taken away my gods which I made, and the priest, and you 2f are gone away: and what have I more? and what [is] this [that] you 2f say unto me, What ails you i?
And the children of Dan [Judge] said unto him, Let not your i voice be heard among us, lest angry fellows run upon you i , and you i lose your i life, with the lives of your i household.
And the children of Dan [Judge] went their way: and when Mikhay’hu [Who is Like God?] saw that they [were] too strong for him, he turned and went back unto his house.

And they took [the things] which Mikhay’hu [Who is Like God?] had made, and the priest which he had, and came unto Layish [Lion] , unto a people [that were] at quiet and secure: and they struck them with the edge of the sword, and burnt the city with fire.

And [there was] no deliverer, because it [was] far from Tzidon [Hunting] , and they had no business with [any] man; and it was in the valley that [lies] by Beit-Rechov [House of the Street] . And they built a city, and dwelt in it.

And they called the name of the city Dan [Judge] , after the name of Dan [Judge] their father, who was born unto Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] : howbeit the name of the city [was] Layish [Lion] at the first.

And the children of Dan [Judge] set up the graven image: and Y’honatan [Yehovah has Given] , the son of Gershom [Exiled One] , the son of M’nasheh [Causing to Forget] , he and his sons were priests to the tribe of Dan [Judge] until the day of the captivity of the land.
And they set them up Mikhay’hu [Who is Like God?] ’s graven image, which he made, all the time that the house of God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] was in Shiloh [Place of Rest].

And it came to pass in those days, when [there was] no king in Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] , that there was a certain Levi (Levite) [Joined to] sojourning on the side of mount Efrayim [Doubly Fruitful] , who took to him a concubine out of Beit-Lechem [House of Bread] in Y’hudah.
And his concubine played the whore against him, and went away from him unto her father’s house to Beit-Lechem [House of Bread] in Y’hudah, and was there four whole months.

And her husband arose, and went after her, to speak friendly unto her, [and] to bring her again, having his servant with him, and a couple of asses: and she brought him into her father’s house: and when the father of the girl saw him, he rejoiced to meet him.
And his father in law, the girl’s father, retained him; and he abode with him three days: so they did eat and drink, and lodged there.

And it came to pass on the fourth day, when they arose early in the morning, that he rose up to depart: and the girl’s father said unto his son in law, Comfort you i heart with a morsel of bread, and afterward go your way.
And they sat down, and did eat and drink both of them together: for the girl’s father had said unto the man, Be content, I pray you i , and wait all night, and let you i heart be merry.
And when the man rose up to depart, his father in law urged him: therefore he lodged there again.
And he arose early in the morning on the fifth day to depart: and the girl’s father said, Comfort your i heart, I pray you i . And they tarried until afternoon, and they did eat both of them.

And when the man rose up to depart, he, and his concubine, and his servant, his father in law, the girl’s father, said unto him, Behold, now the day draws toward evening, I pray you wait all night: behold, the day grows to an end, lodge here, that you i heart may be merry; and tomorrow get you early on your way, that you i may go home.

But the man would not wait that night, but he rose up and departed, and came over against Y’vus [Threshing Place] , which [is] Yerushalayim [Foundation of Peace] ; and [there were] with him two asses saddled, his concubine also [was] with him.

[And] when they [were] by Y’vus [Threshing Place] , the day was far spent; and the servant said unto his master, Come, I pray you i , and let us turn in into this city of the Y’vusi [Threshers, Trampled Under Foot] , and lodge in it.
And his master said unto him, We will not turn aside here into the city of a stranger, that [is] not of the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] ; we will pass over to Giv’ah [Hill].
And he said unto his servant, Come, and let us draw near to one of these places to lodge all night, in Giv’ah [Hill] , or in Ramah [Hill].
And they passed on and went their way; and the sun went down upon them [when they were] by Giv’ah [Hill] , which [belongs] to Binyamin [Son of the Right Hand/Strength].
And they turned aside there, to go in [and] to lodge in Giv’ah [Hill] : and when he went in, he sat him down in a street of the city: for [there was] no man that took them into his house to lodging.

And, behold, there came an old man from his work out of the field at even, which [was] also of mount Efrayim [Doubly Fruitful] ; and he detained (held) in Giv’ah [Hill] : but the men of the place [were of] Benyamin.
And when he had lifted up his eyes, he saw a wayfaring man in the street of the city: and the old man said, Where go you i ? and from what place come you i?

And he said unto him, We [are] passing from Beit-Lechem [House of Bread] in Y’hudah toward the side of mount Efrayim [Doubly Fruitful] ; from there [am] I: and I went to Beit-Lechem [House of Bread] in Y’hudah, but I [am now] going to the house of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) ; and there [is] no man that receives me to house.

Yet there is both straw and provender (food for livestock or cattle) for our asses; and there is bread and wine also for me, and for your i female servant, and for the young man [which is] with your i servants: [there is] no lack of anything.
And the old man said, Peace [be] with you i ; howsoever [let] all your i wants [lie] upon me; only lodge not in the street.
So he brought him into his house, and gave provender (food for livestock or cattle) unto the asses: and they washed their feet, and did eat and drink.

[Now] as they were making their hearts merry, behold, the men of the city, certain sons of Belial [Worthless, Good for Nothing] , beset the house round about, [and] beat at the door, and spoke to the master of the house, the old man, saying, Bring forth the man that came into you i house, that we may know him.
And the man, the master of the house, went out unto them, and said unto them, No, my brethren, [No] , I pray you, do not [so] wickedly; seeing that this man is come into my house, do not this folly.

Behold, [here is] my daughter a virgin, and his concubine; them I will bring out now, and you 2f mistreat them, and do with them what seems good unto you: but unto this man do not so vile (degrading) a thing.

But the men would not hearken to him: so the man took his concubine, and brought her forth unto them; and they raped her, and abused her all the night until the morning: and when the day began to spring, they let her go.
Then came the woman in the dawning of the day, and fell down at the door of the man’s house where her lord [was] , till it was light.

And her lord rose up in the morning, and opened the doors of the house, and went out to go his way: and, behold, the woman his concubine was fallen down [at] the door of the house, and her hands [were] upon the threshold.
And he said unto her, Up, and let us be going. But there was no answer. Then the man took her [up] upon an ass, and the man rose up, and got him unto his place.

And when he was come into his house, he took a knife, and laid hold on his concubine, and divided (cut) her, [together] with her bones, into twelve pieces, and sent her into all the coasts of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God].

And it was so, that all that saw it said, There was no such deed done nor seen from the day that the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] came up out of the land of Mitzrayim [Egypt - The Narrow Place] unto this day: consider of it, take advice, and speak [your minds].

Then all the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] went out, and the congregation was gathered together as one man, from Dan [Judge] even to Be’er-sheva [Well of the sevenfold Oath] , with the land of Gil’ad [Rocky Region] , unto the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) in Mitzpah [Watchtower].

And the chief of all the people, [even] of all the tribes of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] , presented themselves in the assembly of the people of God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] , four hundred thousand footmen that drew sword.

(Now the children of Binyamin [Son of the Right Hand/Strength] heard that the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] were gone up to Mitzpah [Watchtower] .) Then said the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] , Tell [us] , how was this wickedness [committed]?

And the Levi (Levite) [Joined to] , the husband of the woman that was slain, answered and said, I came into Giv’ah [Hill] that [belongs] to Binyamin [Son of the Right Hand/Strength] , I and my concubine, to lodge.

Behold, you 2f [are] all people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] ; give here your advice and counsel.

So all the men of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] were gathered against the city, knit together as one man.
And the tribes of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] sent men through all the tribe of Binyamin [Son of the Right Hand/Strength] , saying, What wickedness [is] this that is done among you?

Now therefore deliver [us] the men, the children of Belial [Worthless, Good for Nothing] , which [are] in Giv’ah [Hill] , that we may put them to death, and put away evil from Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] . But the children of Binyamin [Son of the Right Hand/Strength] would not hearken to the voice of their brethren the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God]:

Among all this people [there were] seven hundred chosen men left-handed; everyone could sling stones at an hair [breadth] , and not miss.
And the men of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] , beside Binyamin [Son of the Right Hand/Strength] , were numbered four hundred thousand men that drew sword: all these [were] men of war.

And the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] arose, and went up to the house of God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] , and asked counsel of God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] , and said, Which of us shall go up first to the battle against the children of Binyamin [Son of the Right Hand/Strength] ? And the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) said, Y’hudah [Let Him (God) Be Praised] [shall go up] first.
And the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] rose up in the morning, and encamped against Giv’ah [Hill].

And the men of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] went out to battle against Binyamin [Son of the Right Hand/Strength] ; and the men of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] put themselves in array (to put on; to clothe) to fight against them at Giv’ah [Hill].
And the children of Binyamin [Son of the Right Hand/Strength] came forth out of Giv’ah [Hill] , and destroyed down to the ground of the Yisra’eli’s that day twenty and two thousand men.

And the people the men of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] encouraged themselves, and set their battle again in array (to put on; to clothe) in the place where they put themselves in array (to put on; to clothe) the first day.

(And the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] went up and wept before the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) until even, and asked counsel of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) , saying, Shall I go up again to battle against the children of Binyamin [Son of the Right Hand/Strength] my brother? And the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) said, Go up against him.)
And the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] came near against the children of Binyamin [Son of the Right Hand/Strength] the second day.

And Binyamin [Son of the Right Hand/Strength] went forth against them out of Giv’ah [Hill] the second day, and destroyed down to the ground of the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] again eighteen thousand men; all these drew the sword.

Then all the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] , and all the people, went up, and came unto the house of God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] , and wept, and sat there before the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) , and fasted that day until even, and offered burnt offerings and peace offerings before the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate).

And the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] enquired of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) , (for the ark of the covenant of God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] [was] there in those days,

And Pinchas [mouth of brass] , the son of El’azar [God has helped] , the son of Aharon [Bright, Very High] , stood before it in those days,) saying, Shall I yet again go out to battle against the children of Binyamin [Son of the Right Hand/Strength] my brother, or shall I cease? And the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) said, Go up; for tomorrow I will deliver them into you i hand.
And Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] set liers in wait round about Giv’ah [Hill].

And the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] went up against the children of Binyamin [Son of the Right Hand/Strength] on the third day, and put themselves in array (to put on; to clothe) against Giv’ah [Hill] , as at other times.

And the children of Binyamin [Son of the Right Hand/Strength] went out against the people, [and] were drawn away from the city; and they began to strike of the people, [and] kill, as at other times, in the highways, of which one goes up to the house of God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] , and the other to Giv’ah [Hill] in the field, about thirty men of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God].

And the children of Binyamin [Son of the Right Hand/Strength] said, They [are] smitten down before us, as at the first. But the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] said, Let us flee, and draw them from the city unto the highways.

And all the men of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] rose up out of their place, and put themselves in array (to put on; to clothe) at Ba’al-Tamar [palm-tree] (lord of the Palms) : and the liers in wait of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] came forth out of their places, [even] out of the meadows of Giv’ah [Hill].
And there came against Giv’ah [Hill] ten thousand chosen men out of all Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] , and the battle was sore: but they knew not that evil [was] near them.

And the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) struck Binyamin [Son of the Right Hand/Strength] before Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] : and the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] destroyed of the Binyamini that day twenty and five thousand and an hundred men: all these drew the sword.

So the children of Binyamin [Son of the Right Hand/Strength] saw that they were smitten: for the men of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] gave place to the Binyamini, because they trusted unto the liers in wait which they had set beside Giv’ah [Hill].
And the liers in wait hasted, and rushed upon Giv’ah [Hill] ; and the liers in wait drew [themselves] along, and struck all the city with the edge of the sword.
Now there was an appointed sign between the men of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] and the liers in wait, that they should make a great flame with smoke rise up out of the city.

And when the men of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] retired in the battle, Binyamin [Son of the Right Hand/Strength] began to strike [and] kill of the men of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] about thirty persons: for they said, Surely they are smitten down before us, as [in] the first battle.
But when the flame began to arise up out of the city with a pillar of smoke, the Binyamini looked behind them, and, behold, the flame of the city ascended up to heaven.
And when the men of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] turned again, the men of Binyamin [Son of the Right Hand/Strength] were amazed: for they saw that evil was come upon them.

Therefore they turned [their backs] before the men of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] unto the way of the wilderness; but the battle overtook them; and them which [came] out of the cities they destroyed in the midst of them.
[Thus] they enclosed the Binyamini round about, [and] chased them, [and] trampled them down with ease over against Giv’ah [Hill] toward the sunrising.
And there fell of Binyamin [Son of the Right Hand/Strength] eighteen thousand men; all these [were] men of valour.

And they turned and fled toward the wilderness unto the rock of Rimmon [Pomegranate] : and they gleaned of them in the highways five thousand men; and pursued hard after them unto Gid’om [a cutting down] , and killed two thousand men of them.
So that all which fell that day of Binyamin [Son of the Right Hand/Strength] were twenty and five thousand men that drew the sword; all these [were] men of valour.
But six hundred men turned and fled to the wilderness unto the rock Rimmon [Pomegranate] , and abode in the rock Rimmon [Pomegranate] four months.

And the men of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] turned again upon the children of Binyamin [Son of the Right Hand/Strength] , and struck them with the edge of the sword, as well the men of [every] city, as the beast, and all that came to hand: also they set on fire all the cities that they came to.
Now the men of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] had sworn in Mitzpah [Watchtower] , saying, There shall not any of us give his daughter unto Binyamin [Son of the Right Hand/Strength] to wife.

And the people came to the house of God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] , and abode there till even before God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] , and lifted up their voices, and wept sore;

And said, O Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) God-Elōhīm (The Living Word) [The Many Powered] of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] , why is this come to pass in Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] , that there should be to day one tribe lacking in Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God]?
And it came to pass on the morrow, that the people rose early, and built there an altar, and offered burnt offerings and peace offerings.

And the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] said, Who [is there] among all the tribes of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] that came not up with the congregation unto the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) ? For they had made a great oath concerning him that came not up to the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) to Mitzpah [Watchtower] , saying, He shall surely be put to death.

And the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] repented them for Binyamin [Son of the Right Hand/Strength] their brother, and said, There is one tribe cut off from Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] this day.
How shall we do for wives for them that remain, seeing we have sworn by the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) that we will not give them of our daughters to wives?

And they said, What one [is there] of the tribes of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] that came not up to Mitzpah [Watchtower] to the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) ? And, behold, there came none to the camp from Yavesh-Gil’ad [Dry Hill of Testimony] to the assembly.
For the people were numbered, and, behold, [there were] none of the inhabitants of Yavesh-Gil’ad [Dry Hill of Testimony] there.

And the congregation sent there twelve thousand men of the most valiant, and commanded them, saying, Go and strike the inhabitants of Yavesh-Gil’ad [Dry Hill of Testimony] with the edge of the sword, with the women and the children.
And this [is] the thing that you 2f shall do, You 2f shall utterly destroy every male, and every woman that has lain by man.

And they found among the inhabitants of Yavesh-Gil’ad [Dry Hill of Testimony] four hundred young virgins, that had known no man by lying with any male: and they brought them unto the camp to Shiloh [Place of Rest] , which [is] in the land of Kena’an [Merchant].
And the whole congregation sent [some] to speak to the children of Binyamin [Son of the Right Hand/Strength] that [were] in the rock Rimmon [Pomegranate] , and to call peaceably unto them.

And Binyamin [Son of the Right Hand/Strength] came again at that time; and they gave them wives which they had saved alive of the women of Yavesh-Gil’ad [Dry Hill of Testimony] : and yet so they sufficed them not.

And the people repented them for Binyamin [Son of the Right Hand/Strength] , because that the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) had made a breach (breaking forth; a break; opening, inlet) in the tribes of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God].
Then the elders of the congregation said, How shall we do for wives for them that remain, seeing the women are destroyed out of Binyamin [Son of the Right Hand/Strength]?
And they said, [There must be] an inheritance for them that be escaped of Binyamin [Son of the Right Hand/Strength] , that a tribe be not destroyed out of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God].

However we may not give them wives of our daughters: for the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] have sworn, saying, Cursed [be] he that gives a wife to Binyamin [Son of the Right Hand/Strength].

Then they said, Behold, [there is] a feast of the Lord-Yehōvah (Messiah Pre-Incarnate) in Shiloh [Place of Rest] yearly [in a place] which [is] on the north side of Beit-El [House of God] , on the east side of the highway that goes up from Beit-El [House of God] to Sh’khem [Shoulder] , and on the south of Levonah [Frankincense].
Therefore they commanded the children of Binyamin [Son of the Right Hand/Strength] , saying, Go and lie in wait in the vineyards;

And see, and, behold, if the daughters of Shiloh [Place of Rest] come out to dance in dances, then come you 2f out of the vineyards, and catch you every man his wife of the daughters of Shiloh [Place of Rest] , and go to the land of Binyamin [Son of the Right Hand/Strength].

And it shall be, when their fathers or their brethren come unto us to complain, that we will say unto them, Be favourable unto them for our sakes: because we reserved not to each man his wife in the war: for you 2f did not give unto them at this time, [that] you 2f should be guilty.

And the children of Binyamin [Son of the Right Hand/Strength] did so, and took [them] wives, according to their number, of them that danced, whom they caught: and they went and returned unto their inheritance, and repaired the cities, and dwelt in them.
And the people of Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] departed there at that time, every man to his tribe and to his family, and they went out from there every man to his inheritance.
In those days [there was] no king in Yisra’el [He Holds Onto The Heel Of God] : every man did [that which was] right in his own eyes.
